content.text: Doctrine: Extraction (primary), Denial (secondary) Culture Origin: Ancient logistics/retail megacorporation. The name is all that remains of a delivery empire that once promised everything, everywhere, in two days. A thousand years later, the Two-Day Promise is a religious covenant. Congo doesn’t just extract from rifts — they warehouse, catalog, distribute, and deliver. The rift is a supply chain. Everything is a supply chain. Aesthetic: Brown and gold. Warehouses the size of cities. Sorting facilities that never close. The arrow logo — once a simple brand mark — has become a sacred geometry. It points forward. Always forward. Citizens wear it over their hearts. Citizen Identity: Fulfillers. Every citizen is part of the chain — picking, packing, shipping, delivering. Not metaphorically. The caste system is literally organized by fulfillment role. Pickers harvest. Packers process. Shippers transport. Deliverers are the warrior-clergy who ensure goods reach their destination. The Founder — a figure of mythic proportions, bald and laughing, ascending to the stars on a pillar of fire — is worshipped as the First Deliverer.

What They Want From Rifts: Volume. Raw materials by the ton. Exotic goods for cataloging and distribution. Congo’s rift operations are industrial-scale extraction with logistics precision. They don’t just mine the rift — they’ve built sorting facilities on the other side. Forward operating warehouses in other dimensions. The supply chain extends through reality itself.
Pay: Volume-based. Base pay is average, but tonnage bonuses are generous. Congo’s motto for contractors: “Fill the manifest.“ The more you haul, the more you earn. Vehicle owners thrive here.

Working For Congo: Efficient. Impersonal. You are a logistics resource. Your contractor ID is a tracking number. Briefings are automated — you receive a manifest, a route, and a deadline. Meet the deadline, get paid. Miss it, get docked. Congo doesn’t hate you. Congo doesn’t think about you. You’re a line on a spreadsheet that either resolves green or red.
